content:
TITLE: Cloning the GitDiagram repository (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to clone the GitDiagram repository from GitHub and navigate into the project directory using the command line. This is the first step in setting up the project for local development or self-hosting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ahmedkhaleel2004/gitdiagram/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/ahmedkhaleel2004/gitdiagram.git
cd gitdiagram
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to install the project's dependencies using pnpm, a package manager.  This command must be run inside the gitdiagram project directory after cloning.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ahmedkhaleel2004/gitdiagram/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm i
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Copying Environment Variables File (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to copy the `.env.example` file to `.env` to begin setting up environment variables.  These environment variables contain API keys and other configurations required for the application to run.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ahmedkhaleel2004/gitdiagram/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cp .env.example .env
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Frontend Development Server (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to start the frontend development server using `pnpm dev`. This command starts the Next.js development server, allowing users to access the website at `localhost:3000`.  This command should be executed from the project's root directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ahmedkhaleel2004/gitdiagram/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Backend with Docker Compose (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to start the backend services using Docker Compose. It builds the necessary Docker images and starts the containers in detached mode. The backend service is a FastAPI server, and it makes it easier to set up the necessary infrastructure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ahmedkhaleel2004/gitdiagram/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker-compose up --build -d
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Local Database (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to start the local PostgreSQL database inside a Docker container. It executes the `start-database.sh` script, which handles the database setup and initialization. Requires `chmod +x start-database.sh` beforehand to make the script executable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ahmedkhaleel2004/gitdiagram/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
chmod +x start-database.sh
./start-database.sh
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Database Schema (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to initialize the database schema using `pnpm db:push`.  This pushes the defined schema to the local Postgres database instance. This command requires the `pnpm` package manager and assumes that the database is already running locally.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ahmedkhaleel2004/gitdiagram/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm db:push
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: List of Python Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: This snippet displays a list of Python packages and their corresponding versions, typical in a requirements file used for dependency management.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ahmedkhaleel2004/gitdiagram/blob/main/backend/requirements.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
